trial_identification.studytitle: The efficacy of the addition of the Pilates Method over a minimal intervention on disability, kinesiofobia, pain intensity and global-perceived effect in patients with chronic non-specific low back pain: A randomised controlled trial.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The efficacy of the addition of the Pilates Method over a minimal intervention on disability, kinesiofobia, pain intensity and global-perceived effect in patients with chronic non-specific low back pain: A randomised controlled trial.

interventions.interventions:
Pilates Group + Minimal intervention
Patients allocated to the Pilates group will receive specific exercises based upon the Pilates method. The Pilates version that will be used on this study will be the "Mat Pilates version" which consists of all usual Pilates exercises performed on a mat (i.e. no special equipment will be used). The patients will receive individualised treatment for 1 hour a day, twice a week over six weeks (i.e. 12 sessions of treatment in total). The progression of the exercises will be performed on an individual basis, based upon the patientÂ´s presentation.
These patients will also receive all components of the minimal intervention group as described below:
Patients will receive instructions from a booklet that contains information on low back pain, anatomy of the lumbar spine and pelvis plus advice on posture and movements related to activities of daily living.
interventions.comparator:
Minimal intervention
Patients allocated to the minimal intervention group will receive instructions from a booklet that contains information on low back pain, anatomy of the lumbar spine and pelvis plus advice on posture and movements related to activities of daily living.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Pain Intensity measured by the Pain Numerical Rating Scale
Disability measured by the Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Function measured by the Patient-Specific Functional Scale
Kinesiophobia measured by the Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia
Global Perceived Effect measured by the Global Perceived Effect Scale

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Low back pain longer than three months
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: pregnancy, contra-indications to exercise, nerve root compromise and serious spinal pathology

trial_design.sequence: Random allocation schedule generated by computer (Excel for Windows).
